mdRecord.dcterms:description: The only two-story, pedimented Hotel, maintained by Simeon B. Chapman (1825-1828). Used as a dining facility until mid-1850s, with residence on the second level. In 1857 an addition was added to the south and it became the University's first gymnasium. Second addition to north, 1890. Now serves as faculty offices for the College of Arts and Sciences. -- Hogan, The Lawn : a guide to Jefferson's university, 1987; Wilson, The Campus Guide: University of Virginia, 2012. [work]
